ygData.subject: Re: BATTLE at the Ark!
ygData.msgSnippet: Silence, it was all Tucson had to go with.  With two of his senses quelled, it was time to rely on a third, touch.  Knowing that talking would not help

Silence, it was all Tucson had to go with.  With two of his senses quelled,=
 it was time to rely on a third, touch.  Knowing that talking would not hel=
p anything at all, he concentrates on the vibrations he feels through his h=
ands, feet, and even the movement of the air around him.  He hoped that Rod=
imus too, would be able to sense touch, and vibration.  He could feel where=
 Rodimus was stepping, and somehow, by that alone, he manages to find him, =
and then starts tapping lightly on his shoulder in a morse code, that could=
 be translated into communication.

" Careful Rodimus, this is one of Night=
razor's tricks.  He's dulled our senses to give the illusion that most of u=
s have been taken off line.  It's what I was able to gather from my intel p=
rocessors."

He thinks for a moment.  This was a great way to communicate b=
ecause Nightrazor may not have any idea that Tucson was still able to commu=
nicate in this mode.  He raises an optic and continues to tap his shoulder.=


" Don't take this the wrong way Rodimus, but it's the only way we can com=
municate in a way that Nightrazor has no notion of us doing so.  Feel free =
to do the same, use the morse coding, it will help us understand each other=
 to apprehend him sufficiantly."

He then taps Straight Shot's shoulder, wh=
o immediately responds by tapping on Tucson's left leg. 

" I bet Nightrazo=
r wasn't planning on us being this resourceful huh?"

Tucson responds back =
on her shoulder.

" He actually left me with no choice but to be resourcefu=
l."

He stops to feel the vibrations of the floor.  Then he puts out his ha=
nd to sense vibrations in the air.  Through that, he could get a faint idea=
 as to how the air circulates around various objects.  A cross breeze as st=
ale as it was, would navigate him toward an emergency generator switch.  He=
 follows that breeze, and extends his hand out to touch it, slowly comming =
to the device.  With another raise of the brow he carefully throws the swit=
ch and waits to see what happens.

Meanwhile, outside the Ark, Uproar could=
 see that he'd be one fried kitty cat if he didn't move his aft out of the =
way of Cyclonus's fire.  In mid air, he's forced to duck the blast, which c=
auses him to lose concentration, and quickly fall to the ground, in a drop =
roll maneuver, until he slams his head up against a boulder, with a loud ba=
ng!

"Owwwww...  Remind me not - ta try that again."

Quickstride now gets =
sick and tired of Waspinator's torment as he too, breaks out the big guns a=
gainst his flying foe.

"Yeah, well, I'm gettn' pretty sick of you dropping=
 your bombs on me too, bug aft!"

He throws continuous rounds from his larg=
e blast cannon while deflecting Waspinator's blasts.  

"TIME FOR SOME MAJO=
R PEST CONTROL!  THIS'LL MAKE YA WISH YA NEVER GOT OUTA YOUR HIVE THIS MORN=
ING!"

As it was for equine nature, Quickstride shows a severe dislike to W=
aspinator, hoping one day he would swat the servos out of him in his wasp m=
ode, with his long, copper tail while in his own equine beast mode.

Furthe=
st away from the Ark, Night Shift pauses for a moment, as does Rat Trap, kn=
owing that if they went in too quickly, something could go wrong.  This was=
 unfamilliar territory now, and the slower they went, and the more careful =
they were, would make a difference as to how they got out of their situatio=
n.

" It's gonna take my GPS forever ta navigate this place.  Got any idea =
what this is, Rat Trap?"

Rat Trap shakes his head.

"No clue, never been h=
ere before..  Now, I don't think Cheetor came this way.  Remember? The last=
 we heard, he was at the Black Fortress."

Night Shift nodds.

"That's righ=
t.  That means he's back there somewhere.  Well, he's one of us, and I'm wi=
lln' ta go the distance if you are."

Rat Trap nodds.

"I'm in.  Someone ha=
s ta help Cheetor.  But first, howd'we get outa here?  If we go back the wa=
y we came, those sweeps will get us for sure."

Night Shift looks around.

=
" Yeah, and if I go alt mode, with just one spare tire, what happens when t=
he others go flat..  My guess is we try'n see if we can find a way outa her=
e where those airheads aren't waitn' for us at the other end.  Once we do t=
hat, we'll head back ta the fortress site'n see if we can pick up on Cheeto=
r.  Let's see, I might be able ta get my GPS online... "

Rat Trap sniffs t=
he air.

"Wait, ya might not need that.  I can smell it, well, the burnt re=
mains anyway, kinda faint, but it's there, all I gotta do is follow the sme=
ll.

Night Shift grits his teeth.

"Slag, no signal.  Yeah we'll have ta go=
 that route little guy."

Slowly Rat Trap follows the scent, but is careful=
 as to where he steps.  Night Shift realizes that he's ten times heavier th=
an Rat Trap, and carefully tests each step as he goes along.

Along the way=
, he notices some botanical life that he had never seen before.  He notices=
 a large moth like insect drinking the nectar from the mysterious plant.

"=
 This place might be strange, but at least it supports life."

He then walk=
s along, leaving the plant and insect alone.

ontrol center for their base. However at the moment the room

rk finally able to close, sealing out the light from the outside,

efully the damage that would come from the outside.

ls first." There was a pause and then a grunt,

ere the fallen ones...

nd then down at the figures at his feet.

nning a small scanner on them. It was Santon

in a heap.

oice. "But

snapped up as he looked at Elita, "Come on, we have to get to

 Quick!"

Tuscon, Rodimus

e main door to the Ark has been sealed. However with the

ult. It is possible to for Hydras to simply blast through. I may

he old Autobots and Decepticons. "I believe at the moment I am the

ne with a working shield."

ff his attack.

the attacks, or allow his

s began to spin in the air, angling away from

onus were some sort of dancer, or an agile bird of

> 
> Even as he moved though,=
 at the top of the jet a twin cannon turret spun,

 then with a pause for target acquisition they opened

 of coruscating power!

> > Meanwhile, Quickstride calibrat=
es his large blast cannon, and takes
> careful aim at Waspinator. He chuckl=
es under his breath.
> >
> > " Bye bye BUGGIE!"
> >
> > His finger pulls ba=
ck on the trigger, as he now attempts to shoot
> Waspinator down.
> 
> <NEW=
>
> 
> Waspinator is not nearly so agile as Cyclonus in the air, nor is he =
built as
> durable. But what he lacks in these two qualities he makes up in=
 tenacity
> and just foolish luck. Buzzing, much like a real wasp he flew i=
n, dodging
> one blast, and then another, until a third one catches him in =
a wing sending
> Waspinator rocketing through the air like a cannon ball.
>=
 
> "Me Waspinator am tired of Maxibots beating on him." Waspinator said as=
 he
> was flung through the air. "Waspinator TERRORIZE!" he said as he shif=
ted
> into his transmetaled form, that of a fighter jet. The battle was far=
 from
> over as he righted himself and came back at Quickstride, guns blazi=
ng!
> 
> Meanwhile as Hydras and Inferno arrived at the door to the Ark, th=
ey found
> it closed, the massive doors clicking as they came to a stop. Ge=
tting into
> the Ark would not be that easy. In fact it was to be much more=
 difficult as
> Quicksilver, Airhammer and Noctorro, three of the Maximal F=
uzors, came
> flying in from one side, firing their weapons at Hydras and I=
nferno as

ras again!

> AND SOME DISTANCE AWAY:
> 
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Rat Trap gr=
ins.
> >
> > "Oooh yeah, good thinkn'. I dunno if I like this place, but it=
's better
> than havn' those airheads blastn' the fuzz off my tail end."
> =
>
> > Together they walk into the dense overgrowth, exploring its parameter=
s
> with what little light comes from Night Shift's high beams.
> 
> <NEW>
=
> 
> As some of the ancient forests actually stretched across much of the N=
orth
> American continent, the `parameters' of the forest stretch out for a=
s far as
> the optic can see. The area inside the forest is not as densely =
overgrown as
> one might imagine. With the canopy of trees over head blocki=
ng most of the
> direct sunlight, at ground level things are fairly clear, =
save for large and
> leafy growths of ferns or other wild plants.
> 
> That=
 does not mean that the ground is flat, as large tree roots, stones and
> b=
roken ground break up the ground making it treacherous for the unaware,
> m=
aking anything close to four wheel travel, even for those of Cybertronian
>=
 descent, extremely difficult and hazardess. There is even the occasional
>=
 large fallen tree here and there; signs that not even the tall spires of t=
he
> forest are immune to the ravages of time and unforeseen occurrence.
> =

> In robot rode, Nightshift and Rat Trap can still hear the movements of
>=
 animals all around them, birds still occasionally fly up or make odd noise=
s
> as they pass. There is the occasional foot print and the obvious sounds=
 of
> passage of large animals, some perhaps larger than a school bus.
> 
>=
 Should these two desire to travel back the scene of Hydras' tower, it migh=
t
> be possible, and maybe even safe from the sweeps that had chased them i=
nto
> the forest, but that does not mean it will be easy or quick.
>

G)
